page.title: 09FARMING AT BAKERS' END.
page.content: Most of the farms around{Bakers' End} are small-holdings. Some of the farm land used to be gravel pits. { {"CASTLEBURY FARM" }has 3 acres of arable land,mainly used for barley, wheat and oil-seed rape.The farm house is C15th and is timber-framed,but was faced with bricks in C19th. Chickens, bantams,bees and ducks are kept. There is a pond for the latter. There are no underground services in the area,not even mains sewerage. {"BAKERS' END FARM"}consists of 17 acres of rough grazing for 3 donkeys, 6 bullocks and 3 horses. The barn used to be the local chapel. {"SCRATCH & PECK POULTRY"}distribute chickens in a 30 mile radius of Bakers End. Fresh chickens are delivered at night and are sent out by van,each morning,to N.London and Cambridge, especially to "fast food" restaurants.
